intro: Ischaemum commutatum, commonly known as narrowleaf beakgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky areas. The plant has slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves with a prominent midrib. Its inflorescence consists of a spikelet-bearing panicle, which produces small, two-lobed spikelets. Ischaemum commutatum is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
